intro: Pecluma oranense, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. Pecluma oranense thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
